messages.original: Ukrainian airspace is now clear of missiles
Ukrainian air defence has been completely overwhelmed in this attack. Very few interceptions overall.
This is MLRS working in the Krasnopillya direction
Iskander on Chernihiv Oblast, then to Kyiv
Iskander on Chernihiv Oblast, then to Kyiv
Flying to Obolon District, northern Kyiv
Flying to Obolon District, northern Kyiv
2 missiles, flying to the city centre, then to southwestern Kyiv
2 Iskanders are flying to Vasylkiv, Kyiv Oblast

The missile attack appears to be over. More than 40 missiles of various types, including an Oreshnik IRBM, were used. I will publish a full report + the consequences later on. 
If you wish to support my work, you can do so here: 
https://buymeacoffee.com/amk_mapping
. 
Thank you for following along.
Additionally, at least 100 Geran-2 drones are flying in the direction of Kyiv. There is a high likelihood of additional missiles being used (not Oreshnik or Kh-101).

Last night, another large-scale, combined Russian missile and drone attack was carried out on Ukraine.
Missiles launched:
~10 Iskander-M ballistic missiles launched from OTRK installations northwest of Klintsy, Bryansk Oblast.
~2 Iskander-M ballistic missiles launched from an OTRK installation in the vicinity of Bryansk City, Bryansk Oblast.
~8 Kalibr cruise missiles launched from 1 "Admiral Makarov" Frigate at Novorossiysk Bay, Krasnodar Krai.
~8 Kalibr cruise missiles launched from 1 "Admiral Essen" Frigate at Novorossiysk Bay, Krasnodar Krai.
~6 Kalibr cruise missiles launched from 1 "Varshavyanka" Submarine in the waters of the Black Sea, off the coast of Cape Myshkako, Krasnodar Krai. 
~1 Oreshnik IRBM launched from the Kapustin Yar Testing Ground, Astrakhan Oblast.
-----------------------
Ukrainian air defence work:
As of the time of writing, Ukrainian air defence is confirmed to have intercepted at least 3 Kalibr cruise missiles.
-----------------------
The main targets for this strike was Ukrainian energy infrastructure in Kyiv. The following was targeted:
CHP-5 Power & Heat Plant, Kyiv Oblast (50.39403, 30.56928) by ~6 Kalibrs & ~4 Iskander-Ms.
CHP-4 Power and Heat Plant, Kyiv Oblast (50.44693, 30.64255) by ~2 Kalibrs.
CHP-6 Power and Heat Plant, Kyiv Oblast (50.53188, 30.66309) by ~5 Kalibrs and ~6 Iskander-Ms.
Underground gas infrastructure in Lviv Oblast by 1 Oreshnik IRBM. 
Unknown target near the Kherson-Mykolaiv regional border by ~6 Kalibrs.
Unknown target southwest of Kyiv by ~2 Iskander-Ms.
-----------------------
Keep in mind, the numbers of missiles launched may be slightly higher than what I've listed, as the number of missiles detected is often lower than actual launches.

Major Battle Begins In Syria‚Äôs Aleppo As Thousands Of Troops Storm Kurdish Neighborhoods (Videos)
The forces of Syria‚Äôs Islamist-led Interim Government launched a large offensive to capture the Kurdish neighborhoods of Sheikh Maqsoud and Ashrafieh in Aleppo from Kurdish fighters affiliated with the Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) late on January 8, just a day after the clashes broke out in the northern city.
Early on in the day, government forces issued a number of evacuation orders covering large parts of the two neighborhoods.
The warnings, coupled with intense shelling and an earlier order declaring Sheikh Maqsoud and Ashrafieh a closed military zone, caused a mass exclusion from the neighborhoods, with state media reporting the displacement of more than 165,000 people.
As the offensive began in the evening, videos emerged online showing dozens of troops, reportedly from the 60th, 72th and 98th divisions, pouring into Sheikh Maqsoud and Ashrafieh in armored personnel carriers and tanks.
Read more 
HERE

Pokrovsk Sector: Russian Army Clears Udachny And Repels Ukrainian Counterattacks¬†
In the Zaporizhzhia sector, where drones are being used extensively, heavy fighting continues for control of the northern part of the Prymorske settlement. Meanwhile, Russian units have crossed the Haichur River and established control over the Bratske settlement.
In the Kharkiv sector, the Russian "North" grouping advanced up to 750 meters on several sections near the Staritsa settlement and consolidated their position in a section of forest southeast of Liman.
In the Krasnyi Liman sector, Russian assault groups advanced on the eastern approaches to Svyatohirsk and captured the Novoselivka railway station. 
Read more 
HERE

Russia Sends Strong Message To Kiev With Oreshnik Strike (Videos)
The Russian Ministry of Defense confirmed that an Oreshnik intermediate-range ballistic missile (IRBM) was used in a group strike that targeted drone production facilities, energy infrastructure and other military-related facilities inside Ukraine over the night of January 8 and 9.
The strike was carried out in response to an attempted ‚Äúterrorist attack by the Kiev regime‚Äù on the residence of Russian President Vladimir Putin in Novgorod Region, the ministry said in a statement.
What sets Oreshnik apart from other IRBMs is its high speed, which reportedly exceeds Mach 10, in addition to its payload, which consists of multiple independently targetable reentry vehicles - previously exclusively used by nuclear weapons - equipped with six warheads, each reportedly containing submunitions.
Read more 
HERE

Another Turkish-Made Akƒ±ncƒ± Combat Drone Bit The Dust In Sudan (Video, Photos)
The Rapid Support Forces (RSF) on January 8 shot down a Turkish-made Bayraktar Akƒ±ncƒ± combat drone of the Sudanese Armed Forces (SAF) over southwestern Sudan, the sixth such confirmed aerial losses in the country in under a year. 
The drone was downed over the city of Nyala in the state of South Darfur, the paramilitary force said in a statement, claiming that it was involved in attacks on civilians.
